hackathon-description-text: Welcome to HackPSU powered by Innoblue and Penn State IEEE! We're a 24 hour hackathon at the Pennsylvania State University with a focus on teaching students how to program as well as encouraging students to build tools that change education and other social issues. Follow us at
hackathon-eligibility: Teams are limited to four people and all team members must be 18 years of age by the start of HackPSU.
hackathon-requirements: Participants can build whatever they want to build. It's a learning hackathon after all and we encourage our students to use HackPSU as a creative outlet for building anything that comes to mind. We encourage students to try to tackle an educational technology issue or a social good issue but any sort of technology-related submissions will be accepted.
hackathon-rules: All projects must be submitted on Challenge Post by Sunday 1:00 PM, March 8th. Teams can be up to 4 members and all projects must be started at hackNY. All team members must be 18 years old by the time HackPSU starts.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Criteria: Use Microsoft API's, Azure, Kinects, or any other Microsoft Product (Windows Phone). The prize is 4 Surface Pro tablets.
All expense paid trip to our EdTech Summit next Fall
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Penn State EdTech Network - Best EdTech Hack
Blockchain - Best Use of Blockchain API
Zonoff - Best Internet of Things Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: JY-MCU Arduino Bluetooth Wireless Serial Port Module
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Penn State IEEE - Best Bluetooth App
Penn State IEEE - Best Guitar Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Provide your best domain name courtesy of Namecheap's .me domain names!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Service Prize - Best use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Winners receive Dell Tablets courtesy of MLH, Github Silver Plan for a year courtesy of Github, 2,500 dollars in branding from BrandBucket, and 50 dollar Dick's Sporting Goods gift cards courtesy of Dick's Sporting Goods.
Winners will receive Chromecasts as well as Github Bronze Plan for a year courtesy of Github.
Winners will receive Raspberry Pi's as well as 6 months of Github Bronze Plan.
Each team member will receive one prize chosen from a list.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does it look nice/is it easy to use?
Is the problem solved in a technically challenging way? Were you impressed by the way the team thought through their problem?
How cool is it? Did it make you say "Damn, that's fucking awesome!!"? Have you ever seen anything like it before? Was it incredibly creative?
